page.title: 12 THE SALING OAK
page.content: The Saling Oak is on the A120. The original Saling Oak used to be across the road that leads to Stebbing Green before is was knocked down and rebuilt on the opposite side of the road. The Saling Oak used simply to be called The Oak but there was a pub with the same name in Braintree and many of the customers got confused. Therefore Mr. and Mrs. Tarrington , the present owners , changed the name. There have been eight previous owners. Their regular customers come mostly from Rayne , Felsted and Dunmow. They don't get any truly local trade because there aren't any villages with in walking distance. There is also a cafe , called the Diner , which lots of passing traffic uses. This is a major source of income helping to keep the pub going.
